item.title: [HELP] Tort demon and Corp beast [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Explisionist Explisionist
item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

add their models.

in the server type ::addmodel or w.e

search client.java to find the command and then type that then the id such as

::addmodel model id

also ur reason after u do that- class5.anIntArray94 = new int[1]; // Number of models the NPC uses

lol? the bold is where the model id goes

item.title: [HELP] Tort demon and Corp beast [HELP]
item.dc:creator: @Dennissuperm Dennissuperm
item.description:
@Dennissuperm wrote:

ints:
Tort Demon

if(i == 292) { // NPC ID aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5]; class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack"; //on mine I changed it to Slay ;) class5.anIntArray94 = new int[1]; class5.anIntArray94[0] = 11512; class5.aString65 = "Tormented Demon"; class5.anInt61 = 702; //combat Level class5.aByteArray89 = "Tormented Demon from the Hell".getBytes(); }

Corp beast

if(i == 293) { // NPC ID aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); // Collect original NPC data class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5]; class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack"; class5.anIntArray94 = new int[1]; // Number of models the NPC uses class5.anIntArray94[0] = 40956; // 28078 class5.aString65 = "Corpreal beast"; // NPC name class5.anInt61 = 777; //combat level class5.aByteArray89 = "The Corp Real beast, LOOKOUT its gonna hurt".getBytes(); // NPC description }
